channel.title: TGaceAllStories
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from TGaceAllStories, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: My eldest son refused to share his father’s $500K inheritance with his siblings. Should I cut him off?
item.description: “My son just said, ‘Dad didn’t want them to get anything.’”

item.title: ‘An argument ensued’: My mother entrusted my inheritance to her second husband. That’s when it all went horribly wrong.
item.description: “He is a managing director at a major bank and probably clears $800,000 per annum.”

item.title: ‘I survived a head-on car wreck’: I’m on Medicaid, but inheriting $290K. How do I protect it from the 5-year look-back rule?
item.description: “About 30 years ago, I survived a head-on car wreck. I was put on 100% disability. I have not worked since.”

item.title: ‘I’m very cynical’: My stepmother, 85, makes bizarre requests for money from my father’s $10M trust. Should I be concerned?
item.description: “He used a crappy lawyer to set up a very boilerplate trust agreement.”

item.title: Stocks have had a good bounce. But here’s why this investment manager thinks lows will be retested.
item.description: Dan Niles worries that we’ve just seen a bear market rally and valuations are still too high

item.title: Top Wall Street analysts pick these stocks for robust growth potential
item.description: TipRanks' analyst ranking service highlights three stocks favored by Wall Street, including Charles Schwab and Netflix

item.title: Earnings playbook: Apple and Meta highlight the busiest week of the season
item.description: Investors look to some of the biggest companies for guidance on how the global trade could impact their bottom lines.

item.title: These U.S. consumer stocks face higher China risks, TD Cowen survey finds
item.description: U.S. brands are rapidly losing their appeal in China, especially as economic growth slows, according to a TD Cowen survey.

item.title: Americans are getting flashbacks to 2008 as tariffs stoke recession fears
item.description: 'It's the old poors teaching the new poors,' said one content creator.

item.title: Amazon and Nvidia say all options are on the table to power AI including fossil fuels
item.description: The tech companies have invested mostly in renewable power, but they are now navigating a changed political environment.
